basics.name: Andrew Gross
basics.label: Senior Frontend Developer
basics.summary: I love frontend development. I like to solve difficult problems and see my work come to life in the browser. I also enjoy spending time with my family outside.

work.summary: Leading team of React devs to maintain multiple SPAs in the ecosystem
highlights: Learning the strengths of everyone on my team to better utilize each person
Converting many of our rest based endpoints to a Node GraphQL architecture.
Architecting a React application with Millions of Product views and dozens of different browsing pages.

work.summary: Converting existing Java/JSP application to a Single Page Application(SPA) using react/redux
highlights: Created a custom react site using React/Redux from the ground up that has over a hundred thousand daily users.
Creating various media players(audio, video, ebook, and comic) from the ground up using react

work.summary: Building REST interfaces using Java and SQL. Multiple services were used by various frontend systems for providing data from user information, playback positions, to vendor reporting.
highlights: Built a solid foundation on the Requirements to create a Java REST Service
Used postgress with standard CRUD opperations
Learned how to use Stripes and JSTL to create web apps in Java

projects.name: Hoopla Digital
projects.snippet: A streaming service for library patrons
highlights: Used React, context and hooks to make custom media players.
Using DRM(Fairplay, HLS, Dash) and a custom UIs built with react to play back music, audiobooks, movies and television episodes.
Used Graphql, Tailwind CSS along with Styled Components to create a custom browsing experience

projects.name: Montana MMIP
projects.snippet: Assisting local authorities with finding missing indigenous people.
highlights: Built using React, Tailwind CSS, and Graphql
The public facing site is used to report people missing
The admin side of the app is used to manage cases, report information to local authorities, and get analytics and reports about cases

projects.name: Howe's Fishing
projects.snippet: Web app for scheduling and trip management
highlights: A full stack application using Node, express, and React/Redux, with custom authentication
Administrators are able to create new trips, check guide availability on a custom calendar, and manage users and guides
Guides can login to the site to see trips they are scheduled for as well as block out availability
Custom emails and SMS text messages are sent to clients and guides when a trip is booked as well as reminding them before the trip

projects.name: Pinnacle Debit Card
projects.snippet: Website for marketing and signup flow for debit cards
highlights: Marketing site generated with React, Styled Components, served with Netlify
Card Creation form with payments through Stripe, and multiple SECURE backend calls with custom token generation for creating a new debit card
